channel.title: My Rendered Animations
channel.description:
I'll keep track of all the animations I've uploaded here, and for you to "enjoy."
These scenes are made in C4D. I simulate fluid particles with another app, then import into C4D. Set up camera and scene and render it all. I've got one I'm rendering right now, but it took 8 hours for the first 30 frames. However that's just the beginning, the middle and end only take a minute or two per frame, so that should go by faster.
Sorry for the horrible quality, google video really fucks up the pixels in these. But that was because I was rendering straight from C4D to a movie. Now I'm importing JPEG sequences into Adobe After Effects and touching up/exporting from there. Doesn't give bad quality on google, as you can tell from the newer ones.
Very first animation, and very simple http://rapidshare.de/files/19393431/Water.mov.html
HL2 Animation for the kids at GMod forums (REALLY bad Google Video fuck up as you can tell -_-) http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-3982637600284194068
Experimented with animating first in C4D and simulating in RF. Sorry for the really fast camera :P http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-5859841414335308346
3AM, so it's a horribly textured scene. Most recent. http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=8866619704163924562
UPDATE: FINALLY this is done. This took days upon days (actually I only had it going during the night) to render. Each frame until the last 100 took nearly an hour for each. I was bored and a simple birthday phrase turned into this. Amazingly, google video verified my video in less than 30 minutes, making this video avaliable a day before her birthday.
http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=7795816697585820404

item.title: My Rendered Animations
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I've been into 3D modeling since I was around 11, playing around with The Sims objects and stuff. I really got into it when I got The Sims 2. I've had Cinema 4D ever since then, and been playing with that.

Tutorialized has some great tutorials for almost everything.

Read full topic

item.title: My Rendered Animations
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Have you ever used doga? Its a really neat program(Designed for people who are not into modelling and stuff), but the rendering takes a very long time on it too.

But C4d looks really good, Im gonna look into it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Rendered Animations
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Thanks.

It's REALLY user friendly IMO. Everything is right there, and organized. If you're going for rendering, you might as well get another renderer also. Advanced Renderer (C4D's renderer) is pretty good, but the GI system in it BLOWS. Takes hours on hours. I've bought finalRender and I am extremely pleased with it. GI solutions are more accurate tenfold, and increasingly faster.

A simple scene with a ball and lit by HDRI with GI on in AR takes quite a few minutes. In fR, it takes less than 30 seconds almost. Scale that up for a big scene, and it's a huge improvement.

Read full topic

item.description:
